column13: Goodman's safety strategy during FY23 was to continue the proactive and practical implementation of Goodman's Minimum Construction Safety Standards. This is particularly important in regions where the industry standards are below Goodman's expectations Ã¢ÂÂ and for the second year running, Goodman is pleased to report zero fatal accidents on Principal Contractor-controlled sites.

Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Goodman continued to support the Property Council of Australia's 500 Women in Property Mentoring Program in FY23, with 10 participants selected from Goodman. The program aims to promote women into leadership positions in the property industry.
column20: 500 Women in Property Mentoring Program, Property Council of Australia, leadership

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Goodman invests in training its people to help develop the skills they need. Goodman provides training in some ways, including internal and external training resources, in-person sessions and through the online learning platform LinkedIn Learning, which provides a content catalogue via the Group's global learning system, Aspire. Aspire is Goodman's gateway to professional development and self-paced skills training in compliance, technical and management skills.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Goodman's In-Focus Program is where team members present on an area of technical expertise, are highly valued and help create a learning culture through peer-to-peer knowledge sharing. This year, Goodman continued the global communications training program facilitated by an external writing expert. The program has been rolled out in Australia, New Zealand, Continental Europe, Hong Kong SAR and the US, with plans for in-language training in Japan underway.
column20: In-Focus program, technical expertise, learning culture

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Goodman's Greater China team previously developed its competency framework designed to assist employees in identifying what skills and experiences they require to progress their development and learning pathways. Different training formats are also utilised to cater to various learning preferences and contexts, with sessions customised to accommodate individual needs and collaborative learning.
column20: Greater China team, competency framework, learning pathway

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
column13: Monitoring performance and providing competitive remuneration and benefits is crucial to the development of Goodman's people. The annual performance review and development process helps focus on career aspirations, goals, and potential training. It helps plan for role progression, identifying any required specialised management training. This training includes peer-to-peer engagement with Goodman's senior leadership team and management committees, further assisting with succession planning and leadership for the longer term.
column20: Annual performance review, career aspiration, specialised management training

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Goodman fosters a work culture of inclusivity and diversity and focuses on the well-being, health and safety of its people and its contractors through the Inclusion and Diversity Policy. Goodman supports health and well-being through flexible working arrangements as well as learning, development and equal opportunities.
column20: Inclusion and Diversity Policy, well-being, health, safety

Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column13: Goodman maintains internal processes and controls to comply with legal and contractual obligations and manage entitlements relating to its people. Annually, Goodman undertakes a gender pay review to identify conscious or unconscious bias and improve outcomes' integrity. There were no significant issues identified in FY23.
column20: Gender pay review, entitlement, unconscious bias

column13: Goodman developed a modern slavery factsheet that its regions can share with suppliers. The factsheet explains what constitutes modern slavery. It aims to raise awareness on how to spot modern slavery and the expectations of Goodman's suppliers.

column6: Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column13: Goodman continued to embed its human rights and modern slavery commitments and expanded its regional working groups in its operating regions. Goodman held over 30 modern slavery formal workshops for its regional working groups, which include representatives from operational teams (developments and property services), procurement, legal and risk, reinforcing Goodman's commitment to combating modern slavery through sharing best practice outcomes and expertise.
column20: Modern slavery formal workshop, regional working group, modern slavery commitment

column6: Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column13: In Brazil, Mainland China (China) and the US, signs are being installed across Goodman's developments to raise awareness of modern slavery and labour law compliance issues for workers on site and educate them about their rights, risks, and Goodman's reporting channels.
column20: Sign, modern slavery, labour law compliance
